name: 11.10 "Daddy's Little Middle Aged Girl" Online Trivia | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: How long was Woody's lease for?
questions.explanation:
10 years.

	He said he had to do some fancy talking to get it. Most people would consider this a horrible thing since the average lease is one year for an apartment.

questions.text: Why didn't Frasier want to go to Hanover?
questions.correct: He didn't want  to end up a human sacrifice to the corn god.
options: He thought he would miss Cheers too much.
He didn't want to end up like Woody.
He was afraid he would get maimed or killed like Woody's relatives.
questions.explanation:
He didn't want  to end up a human sacrifice to the corn god.

	Woody made a comment that in Hanover the man was the head of house and all his "wives" had to listen. He then said "wife" and said he and everyone in Hanover knew it was illegal to have more than one wife. Norm asked if anyone else was curious about Hanover and when he asked Frasier about going that was his reason for saying no.

Captain Franklin E. Howe

	He was in the United States Navy. He made Sam very nervous because he wasn't happy that Sam tried to get Rebecca pregnant without being married.

Brig.

	He was called that because he put so many soldiers in jail. Carla asked why they called her Brig.

questions.text: Who told Rebecca's father that she burned down the bar?
questions.explanation:
Woody.

	Rebecca was asking the others not to tell about the dumb things she'd done, especially burning down the bar. Woody wasn't around for Rebecca's pleading so he told her father everything.

questions.text: At what age did Cliff's mom stop giving him an allowance?
questions.explanation:
30.

	Carla told everyone that Rebecca still got a raise from her father. She overheard that Rebecca asked for a raise in her allowance. Rebecca tried to cover saying she said, "that old crazy Jack Palance".

questions.text: What did Rebecca's father tell her she had to do?
questions.correct: Return to San Diego to live with him and her mother
options: Buy Sam a sailboat to make up for burning down his bar
Learn to survive on her own
Quit Cheers and find a job where she is better suited
questions.explanation:
Return to San Diego to live with him and her mother.

	Rebecca threw a temper tantrum saying she hated her father. She said she wished she'd never been born and ran into the office.

questions.text: Did Rebecca agree to do what her father wanted?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	She told Captain Howe he was right as usual. Sam tried to stop her, and she told him she was just a failure in Boston.

questions.text: What did Norm say he was in once?
questions.explanation:
Coast guard.

	Captain Howe said, "Well you must be very proud, Miss." Norm said, "Buy a girl a drink?" Captain Howe had a very strong opinion on everything and apparently he didn't think real men belonged in the Coast Guard.

questions.text: How much did Rebecca's father raise her allowance?
questions.explanation:
75%.

	Her mother told her to pretend she would go home. She called her mother and said, "The fish bit." Then she told her mother that her cut was in the mail. She got the advice from her mother earlier, when she went into the office during her temper tantrum.
